articles.title: Tony Romo wins third American Century celebrity title in playoff
articles.description: Tony Romo won the American Century Championship for the third time, beating Mark Mulder and Joe Pavelski with a 5-foot birdie putt on the second hole of a playoff Sunday.
articles.content:
STATELINE, Nev. -- Tony Romo won the American Century Championship for the third time, beating Mark Mulder and Joe Pavelski with a 5-foot birdie putt on the second hole of a playoff Sunday.

articles.title: Los Angeles Angels star Shohei Ohtani named to American League All-Star team as pitcher and hitter
articles.description: Los Angeles Angels star Shohei Ohtani was elected to the American League All-Star team as a pitcher and hitter for the second consecutive season, while brothers William and Willson Contreras will both start for the National League.

articles.title: Agent - Danilo Gallinari reaches two-year, $13.3 million deal with Boston Celtics
articles.description: Danilo Gallinari has agreed on a two-year, $13.3 million deal with the Celtics after clearing waivers, his agent told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski on Sunday.
articles.content:
After clearing waivers, free-agent forward Danilo Gallinari has agreed to a two-year, $13.3 million deal with the Boston Celtics, his agent, Michael Tellem of Excel Sports, told ESPN on Sunday.

articles.title: Wimbledon champion Novak Djokovic, still 'not planning to get vaccinated,' set to skip US Open
articles.description: Just hours after winning his fourth-straight title at Wimbledon, Novak Djokovic confirmed that he had no plans to receive the COVID-19 vaccination and, as a result, doesn't foresee himself playing in the US Open.

articles.title: Brittney Griner's name permeates WNBA All-Star Game, Team Wilson beats Team Stewart
articles.description: Brittney Griner was at the forefront of the WNBA's All-Star Game, which was won by Team Wilson 134-112 over Team Stewart.
articles.content:
CHICAGO -- A'ja Wilson, Breanna Stewart and the rest of the WNBA All-Stars lined up along the sideline after halftime, the No. 42 and the name Griner on the back of all of their jerseys.

articles.title: Minnesota Lynx's Sylvia Fowles throws down first-half dunk in her final WNBA All-Star Game
articles.description: Minnesota's Sylvia Fowles slammed home a breakaway dunk in her final All-Star Game appearance. Fowles, who is retiring at season's end, also dunked in her first All-Star Game in 2009.
articles.content:
CHICAGO -- WNBA legend Sylvia Fowles stole the show in the first half of the 2022 All-Star Game when she dunked on a breakaway opportunity, much to the delight of the packed Wintrust Arena crowd.

articles.title: Novak Djokovic defeats Nick Kyrgios to win seventh Wimbledon title
articles.description: Top-seeded Novak Djokovic defeated Nick Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6 (3) on Sunday to win his fourth straight Wimbledon championship and seventh overall.
articles.content: LONDON -- Novak Djokovic used his steady brilliance to beat the ace-delivering, trick-shot-hitting Nick Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6 (3) on Sunday for a fourth consecutive Wimbledon championship and se… [+4997 chars]

articles.description: Offensive tackle Duane Brown was arrested at Los Angeles International Airport on Saturday for allegedly possessing a concealed weapon.
articles.content:
